BOARD OF VISITORS. THOMAS JEFFERSON, Rector. THOMAS JEFFERSON, JAMES MADISON, CHAPMAN JOHNSON, JOSEPH C. CABELL, JAMES BRECKENRIDGE, JOHN H. COCKE, GEORGE LOYALL. Secretary of the Board, PETER MINOR.
May 1st, 1880. Catalogues of the students attending the early sessions have never before been published. James F. Harrison, Chairman.

FACULTY AND OFFICERS. GEORGE TUCKER, Chairman of the Faculty. GEORGE LONG, Professor of Ancient Languages. GEO. BLAETTERMANN, Professor of Modern Languages. TH: HEWITT KEY, Professor of Mathematics. CHARLES BONNYCASTLE, Professor of Natural Philosophy. JOHN P. EMMET, Professor of Chemistry. GEORGE TUCKER, Professor of Moral Philosophy. ROBLEY DUNGLISON, Professor of An. and Medicine, Secretary of the Faculty. JOHN V. KEAN, Librarian. ARTHUR S. BROCKENBROUGH, Proctor. ALEXANDER GARRETT, Bursar.

CATALOGUE OF STUDENTS. FIRST SESSION.—MARCH 7th, 1825. ABBREVIATIONS. A. L.—Ancient Languages. C.—Chemistry. M. L.—Modern Languages. M. P.—Moral Philosophy. M.—Mathematics. MED.—Medicine. N. P.—Natural Philosophy. NAMES. RESIDENCES. SCHOOLS ATTENDED. Ambler, Philip St. G. Richmond, Va. M L, M, N P Allen, William G. Fredericksburg, Va. M L, C, MED Anderson, Richard Richmond, Va.
